title: Health input app with tailored food recommendations

requirements.text: Create a backend API that accepts a user's health inputs (age, weight, list of sicknesses/health conditions, and blood pressure) and returns a structured list of recommended foods tailored to those inputs.

quotes: create a app where you can put your sicknesses, age, weight and stuff also with blood pressure and when you click a button labeled “Search Foods” it shows food that can help you with your sicknesses, blood pressure, and health

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update/query method (or methods) that takes: age, weight, sicknesses/conditions, and blood pressure values.
Backend returns a deterministic, typed response containing a list of recommended foods (at minimum: name and short explanation for why it was recommended).
The API returns a user-friendly error when required inputs are missing or invalid (e.g., negative age/weight, non-sensical blood pressure values).

requirements.text: Implement backend recommendation logic that uses sickness/condition keywords and blood pressure categories (e.g., low/normal/elevated/high) to select foods and provide brief explanations per food item.

quotes: shows food that can help you with your sicknesses, blood pressure, and health

acceptanceCriteria: Recommendation results change based on different inputs (e.g., different conditions or blood pressure ranges yield different food lists).
Each recommended food includes an explanation that references the relevant input factor(s) (condition and/or blood pressure category).
If a user provides a condition that is not recognized, the backend still returns a safe default set of general healthy foods plus a note that some conditions were not recognized.

requirements.text: Build a frontend flow with a health input form (age, weight, sicknesses/health conditions, systolic and diastolic blood pressure) and a primary button labeled exactly “Search Foods” that triggers fetching recommendations and then displays the results.

quotes: put your sicknesses, age, weight and stuff also with blood pressure

acceptanceCriteria: The main form includes fields for: Age, Weight, Systolic BP, Diastolic BP, and Sicknesses/Health conditions (free text and/or tag input).
The primary call-to-action button text is exactly “Search Foods”.
Client-side validation prevents submission with empty required fields or obviously invalid numeric values and shows clear English error messages.
On submit, the UI shows a loading state and then renders the recommended foods returned by the backend.

requirements.text: Create a results view that displays recommended foods with explanations, and includes a clear English disclaimer that the app provides general wellness suggestions and is not medical advice.

quotes: food that can help you with your sicknesses, blood pressure, and health

acceptanceCriteria: Results are displayed as a readable list/cards with food name and explanation.
A disclaimer is visible on the results view (e.g., “This app provides general food suggestions and is not medical advice.”).
Users can easily go back and adjust inputs without losing usability (e.g., a Back/Edit Inputs button or link).

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, creative visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styles) appropriate for a health/nutrition tool, avoiding blue-and-purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a consistent theme applied across input and results views (background, typography, buttons, and cards).
Primary palette is not dominated by blue and purple.
Layout is clean and accessible (clear labels, adequate contrast, readable font sizes).

requirements.text: Add generated static imagery for the app and render it from the frontend as static assets (do not serve images from the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: New images (from image requirements) are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
UI references these images via static paths and they render correctly in the browser.
No backend endpoints are added for image hosting/serving.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other immutable paths defined by the platform; compose those components instead.
Do not rely on external databases or third-party APIs for nutrition/medical data.
nonGoals: Providing medical diagnosis or emergency guidance.
Integrating a comprehensive external food/nutrition database.
User accounts beyond what the template provides (no custom auth requirements).
Long-term tracking/analytics of historical measurements unless explicitly requested later.
